title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, July 14, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss writes to his wife that the Confederate army is back in Virginia, and not demoralized at all after Gettysburg, and ridicules the lack of pursuit by the Union troops. He comments also on affairs at home.
keywords: Troop Movement, Military Authority, Patriotism, Battle Description, Military Strategy, Women, Home Front, Family, Death/Casualties, African Americans, Slavery, American Civil War
